info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 10:16PM EDT until June 17 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following county, in west central Ohio, Greene.
* WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1016 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Kettering, Beavercreek, Xenia, Bellbrook, Yellow Springs, Cedarville, Jamestown, Wilberforce, New Jasper, Centerville, Oldtown, John Bryan State Park, Trebein, Greene County Airport, Bell Center, Gladstone and Rosemoor.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT TUESDAY
